p: The use of medicinal and aromatic plants has strong roots in the traditional medicine since antiquity, from the treatment of minor illnesses to more contemporary diseases [ 143]. Since then, evolving from simple maceration and decoction, based on modern approaches, research has reached a top level of technologicalization in which bioactive compounds are successfully recovered or even purified [ 144]. Our group presented in a published paper the most recent findings and approaches for the recovery of phytoconstituents from MAPs [ 1], so now, we will focus for this paper on future perspectives of using these compounds for further applications.
